citations.narrative:
A current record of guinea pigs on hand was not available for review during this inspection. There were no inventory
records kept for several months indicating the number of adult guinea pigs and newborns present except for a weekly
count of new weanlings removed from adult enclosures. A total of 506 adult guinea pigs, 206 weanlings, and 148
newborns were counted during this inspection. Failure to maintain these records can make it difficult to assess the health
of the caviary by identifying animal losses by decreased number of guinea pigs born or raised. Licensee must maintain
records containing the required information for animals which disclose the number of guinea pigs held, owned, acquired
or disposed of including births and deaths. Remains uncorrected.

Structural strength. There were 8 guinea pig enclosures in the workshop with barn swallow nests with offspring in this
area. A total of 87 adult guinea pigs and 7 newborns were present in the workshop due to lack of enclosure space in the
animal room. Indoor housing facilities for guinea pigs must be structurally sound, maintained in good repair, protect the
guinea pigs from injury, and restrict other animals from entering. Bird droppings can contaminate enclosures and other
surfaces which can affect the health of guinea pigs. Guinea pigs can not be housed in areas that do not restrict other
animals from entering. Correct by September 1, 2023.

Space. Insufficient space was being provided in two weanling enclosures. Weanling enclosures measure 24 inches wide
by 78 inches long or 1872 square inches of floor space. The top enclosure was housing 85 male weanlings, and the
bottom enclosure was housing 76 female weanlings. Weanlings weighing up to 350 grams require at least 60 inches of
floor space each. Can not house more than 31 guinea pig weanlings in this size enclosure.
Insufficient space can cause stress and increase aggression in animals which can increase bites, scratches, ear chewing,
and other injuries. Licensee must ensure that guinea pigs are provided with at least the minimum amount of floor space
per animal to prevent overcrowding and aggression. Correct by August 22, 2023.

There were 8 enclosures in the workshop adjacent to the guinea pig room housing replacement guinea pig breeders and
their offspring. A total of 87 adult guinea pigs and 7 newborns were present in this workshop. There were at least 11 barn
swallow nests in this area with two nests containing offspring. Numerous swallow droppings were present on the floor,
walls, and room surfaces in the workshop. Bird droppings can contaminate surfaces and enclosures housing guinea pigs.
Guinea pigs must be housed in facilities that restrict the entrance of other animals. An effective program for the control for
birds and other pests must be established and maintained to protect the health of the guinea pigs. Correct by September
1, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.75(b)(1)  Repeat
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
A current record of guinea pigs on hand was not available for review during this inspection. There were no inventory 
records kept for several months indicating the number of adult guinea pigs and newborns present except for a weekly 
count of new weanlings removed from adult enclosures. A total of 506 adult guinea pigs, 206 weanlings, and 148 
newborns were counted during this inspection. Failure to maintain these records can make it difficult to assess the health 
of the caviary by identifying animal losses by decreased number of guinea pigs born or raised. Licensee must maintain 
records containing the required information for animals which disclose the number of guinea pigs held, owned, acquired 
or disposed of including births and deaths. Remains uncorrected. 
3.25(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
Structural strength. There were 8 guinea pig enclosures in the workshop with barn swallow nests with offspring in this 
area. A total of 87 adult guinea pigs and 7 newborns were present in the workshop due to lack of enclosure space in the 
animal room. Indoor housing facilities for guinea pigs must be structurally sound, maintained in good repair, protect the 
guinea pigs from injury, and restrict other animals from entering. Bird droppings can contaminate enclosures and other 
surfaces which can affect the health of guinea pigs. Guinea pigs can not be housed in areas that do not restrict other 
animals from entering. Correct by September 1, 2023. 
3.28(c)(1)(iii) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
Space. Insufficient space was being provided in two weanling enclosures. Weanling enclosures measure 24 inches wide 
by 78 inches long or 1872 square inches of floor space. The top enclosure was housing 85 male weanlings, and the 
bottom enclosure was housing 76 female weanlings. Weanlings weighing up to 350 grams require at least 60 inches of 
floor space each. Can not house more than 31 guinea pig weanlings in this size enclosure.  
 
Insufficient space can cause stress and increase aggression in animals which can increase bites, scratches, ear chewing, 
and other injuries. Licensee must ensure that guinea pigs are provided with at least the minimum amount of floor space 
per animal to prevent overcrowding and aggression. Correct by August 22, 2023.

3.31(c) 
   
Sanitation. 
There were 8 enclosures in the workshop adjacent to the guinea pig room housing replacement guinea pig breeders and 
their offspring. A total of 87 adult guinea pigs and 7 newborns were present in this workshop. There were at least 11 barn 
swallow nests in this area with two nests containing offspring. Numerous swallow droppings were present on the floor, 
walls, and room surfaces in the workshop. Bird droppings can contaminate surfaces and enclosures housing guinea pigs. 
Guinea pigs must be housed in facilities that restrict the entrance of other animals. An effective program for the control for 
birds and other pests must be established and maintained to protect the health of the guinea pigs. Correct by September 
1, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
